description:
Company Description

“To be the most loved everyday food and groceries destination!” - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’).

foodpanda is the largest food and grocery delivery platform in Asia, outside of China. Operating in more than 400 cities across 11 markets, we continue to expand and grow in our core food delivery business, as well as in new verticals like grocery deliveries, with a strong tech infrastructure at our core. From our restaurants-partners, cloud kitchens and cloud grocery stores — foodpanda is just one tap away, getting everything you need into your hands quickly and conveniently!

If you love working with technology to create solutions and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done, you will find your tribe here at foodpanda. foodpanda comprises of people from more than 60 nationalities, and we believe in winning through diversity.
foodpanda is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide

Job Description

We’re looking for a highly-driven and motivated Commercial Analyst Intern for our team in Singapore. The duration of the assignment will be for 6 months minimum. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on exposure and have a direct impact, then this may be the place for you! He/She will assist the Senior Commercial Analyst to support the project management team on various projects, while still being able to work independently.
The ideal candidate This role will be based in Singapore and will report to the Senior Manager, Commercial Projects.
About the job:
We’re looking for a highly-driven and motivated Commercial Analyst Intern for our team in Singapore. In this role you will be working with big data, testing, analyzing and building models to provide strategic insights to the business as well as comprehensive solutions. If you are looking for a dynamic environment where you will be exposed to projects covering operations, marketing, commercial and finance, then this may be the place for you!
Responsibilities:
Conduct thorough, insightful and skilfully presented deep-dives into specific business topics and trends
Work closely with teams in the commercial department to understand business challenges and recommend solutions across the various projects.
Monitoring project KPIs, building and managing project dashboard to help evolve and define project vision and growing projects within budget and within scope
Analyze the data, create hypotheses, run experiments & prove the customer value as recommendations to the company
Automate and validate newly created reports and develop corrective actions to improve data integrity and quality
Support ad-hoc data requests and analysis

Qualifications

Requirements:
Analytical mind and business acumen with ability to work with large amounts of data to discover patterns and trends and to form conclusions based on findings. Must be extremely detail oriented.
Excellent analytical skills, independent thinking, data oriented, and knowledge of analytics tools required (SQL, Excel, Python)
Willingness to learn in a fast moving environment and eager to deliver the extra mile
Strong data visualization and statistical skills
High-energy with sound business acumen
Good communication and presentation skills
Quick learner and proven ability to handle multiple projects concurrently
Ability to work independently and within a team
Good command of English (Spoken & Written)
Exhibits the competencies: Drive for results, action-oriented, problem solving & analytical thinking
Adaptability to change
Positive and proactive attitude

Additional Information

What we offer:
A dynamic and challenging work environment.
A company committed to developing you personally and professionally.
A great working atmosphere with regular company and team events.
A vibrant and international team committed to diversity and inclusion.
Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners.

Whether you’re at the start of your career or looking to discover your next adventure, your story begins here. At Citi, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your skills and make a difference at one of the world’s most global banks. We’re fully committed to supporting your growth and development from the start with extensive on-the-job training and exposure to senior leaders, as well as more traditional learning. You’ll also have the chance to give back and make a positive impact where we live and work through volunteerism.
Shape your Career with Citi
Citi’s Enterprise Services and Public Affairs (ESPA) aims to enhance how our stakeholders perceive and experience Citi. We manage our reputation by engaging with our stakeholders and delivering great spaces and services to colleagues and clients.
We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as Assistant Vice President, Country Real Estate Services (RES) Analyst - Hybrid (Internal Job Title: Business Analytics Senior Analyst - C12) based in Changi Business Park, Singapore. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well-being to help plan for your future. For instance:
We believe all parents deserve time to adjust to parenthood and bond with the newest members of their families. That’s why in early 2020 we began rolling out our expanded Paid Parental Leave Policy to include Citi employees around the world.
We empower our employees to manage their financial well-being and help them plan for the future.
We have a variety of programs that help employees balance their work and life, including generous paid time off packages.
Reports to Singapore Country Head, responsible for overall control of expenses and recoveries for Singapore (SG) portfolio and maintenance of all Real Estate Services (RES) General Ledger (GL) accounts, and maintain oversight over Vietnam and Indonesia GL accounts.
In this role, you’re expected to:
Financial Analysis and reporting
Responsible for overall control of expenses and recoveries for Singapore portfolio and maintenance of all RES GL accounts; oversight over Vietnam and Indonesia accounts
Month end check - track actuals against plan, forecast, prior month. Provide explanations for expense variance for all stake holders – Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) (for flash reporting), Country team, management
Pro-active forecasting of RES SG plan numbers (Line of Sight) for management reporting purposes based on trend, updates etc. Liaison with Transactions/Facilities Management/Project Management teams
Monthly submission of investment file, productivity file and Risk and Control (R&C) template
Review Direct charges and collate the quarterly True Up/ True Down for onward submission to Global for approval
Ensure project closures as per policy and track against plan. Accruals to be taken, if needed
Fixed Asset recon and checking of monthly additions / depreciation
Co-ordinate for annual Fixed Asset (FA) inventory count exercise. Ensure RES FA balances are updated
Processing of Global housing related re-class entries into RES lines and charge out to business. Work with Human Resources on tracking of rental and related cost
Post Proof transition to Finance & Risk Shared Services (FRSS), responsible for maintenance of accurate GL balances, proofing records and ensure 'no ageing' in General Ledger balances
Single point contact to regional, country, FA queries for SG RES
Annual budgeting exercise, Quarterly Multi-year Multi-scenario Forecasting (QMMF), Forecasts/, deepdives.
Work with SG RES team to provide financial inputs for Initiative Expenditure Proposal (IEP) preparation, Real Estate (move v/s stay) analysis etc.
Computing, reporting and tracking of reserves
Engage with Audit team, regional Compliance for SG related queries
Operations & Processing
Work with SG RES team and Finance & Risk Shared Services (FRSS) Lease Admin team for rental run. Accruals entries to be passed as needed
Utility tracking, re-class entries for General Interbank Recurring Order (GIRO) payments. Month End Accrual process for utilities
Monthly processing of entries for Financial Accounting Standards (FAS) 143 [Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) Interpretation No. (FIN) 47, asset amortizations
Processing of third-party vendor baseline billing, Accruals if necessary
Work with Facilities / Asset managers to track repair expenditure. Month end accrual process for repair and maintenance
Any other entries, Invoice processing / accruals as needed for one timers, regional expense etc,
Responsible for maintenance of all records (physical payment memos, approved reserve schedules, approved amortization/ FIN 47 schedule, Security Deposit and advances schedule) for Audit trail (soft and physical) and proofing
APS System Lead
Overall responsible for maintenance (service order opening etc) and processing of premise recovery on APS system
Work closely with Facilities Management (FM) for Space & Occupancy (Archibus) update
Monthly processing of billing file, Manual recoveries and entries as and when needed
One-point contact for all charging related queries, charges outlook submissions to regional FP&A and business
Project Management (PM) & Facilities Management (FM) Analysis and forecasting
Tracking of actuals against plan for all FM charges – Utilities, cleaning, Main Contracts, Repairs, above base expenditure
Track third party vendor baseline invoicing and Change Request (CR) and forecasting
Track closures of all Projects, including capitalization and accruals.
Provide inputs for FM & PM annual budgeting.
Compliance
Manage Control Assessment (MCA) documentation support.
Legal Entity Management (LEM) – provide data for the LEM submission
Institute of Chartered Secretaries and Administrators (ICSA) set-up and management with country controllers.
Compliance with Record Management policy. Storage, management, destruction of physical and digital records.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
As a successful candidate, you’d ideally have the following skills and exposure:
Qualifications:
5-8 years of experience
This position requires excellent analytical and business strategy skills
Effective communication skills
Ability to present to business partners and/or leaders to gain approvals
Project and process management skills
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Experience with a prior focus in financial services analytics
Self-starter who also has a demonstrated ability to work successfully in team environment and drive

Education:
Bachelors/University degree or equivalent finance experience

Take the next step in your career, apply for this role at Citi today

job title: Senior Data Analyst, O&T Quality Assurance
description:
The O&T Chief Operating Office (O&T COO) is a driving factor in delivering value to our organization, our businesses, regulators, and stakeholders.
The O&T Quality Assurance (QA) in O&T’s COO function and is responsible to provide strong oversight, facilitate reviews and support Citi’s effective management of operational and technology risks. This role is reporting to the O&T Quality Assurance Innovation and Analytics Lead based in Singapore, responsible for the production and delivery of O&T QA tooling & reporting requirements. The ideal candidate for this role is a highly motivated, individual contributor who also works well in a global team and a diverse environment.
Key Responsibilities:
Source, check, produce and update Quality Assurance Book of Work from imperfect and disparate data sources on a recurring basis.
Create various dashboards to provide management with a view on current Book of Work, quality review progress, resourcing availability, etc.
Maintain in-house workflow management tool to ensure up-to-date data availability and suggest improvements to tooling.
Provide analytical expertise to support the implementation of various O&T QA processes (e.g. thematic analysis, analytical testing).
Support O&T QA Management Team to implement escalation criteria and practices to ensure issues and risks are escalated timely and reporting to senior management occurs appropriately, consistently and at the right levels.
Establish strong working relationships with stakeholders and management to enable smooth coordination of reporting activities.
Be proactive and self-motivated in driving quality and timely reporting end-to-end.
Contribute to continued improvement in O&T QA procedures and coverage through the delivery of quality QA Book of Work and reporting products
Assist O&T QA Innovation & Analytics Lead on day-to-day basis with ad-hoc requests/projects, review of O&T QA internal and external deliverables.
This is a global role and involves interaction with stakeholders across APAC, EMEA and NAM. Work timings accordingly will remain flexible.
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.
Qualifications:
6-7 years of experience with hands-on responsibilities in reporting related processes. Financial services industry and/or risk and control experience is a plus, as is prior experience in quality assurance / control and monitoring processes.
Demonstrated success in providing timely, high-quality and insightful data analytics and reporting under tight deadlines and among multiple competing deliverables, with flexibility to prioritize workload accordingly.
Superior oral and written communication skills in English, and in particular ability to assess and contribute to the content of committee reporting and production of materials meant for ‘Board-level’ and senior management.
Intellectually curious, consistently evaluating “what is the data telling me?” and “why does it matter?"
Excellent data visualization skills to distill hard data points into easy to understand and insightful materials and communications for stakeholders to consume.
Advanced level of proficiency with MS Office suite (especially Excel and PowerPoint) is necessary.
Advanced level of proficiency with dashboard tools is necessary. Proven practical experience of implementations done in PowerBI and/or Tableau is advantageous.
Exposure to data analytics toolkits in Python or R is advantageous.
Knowledge and experience in front-end web development (Javascript libraries) is advantageous.
Knowledge and experience in SharePoint development (e.g. create & maintain Lists, interact with the REST API) is highly advantageous.
Education:
BS/BA degree or equivalent combination of education/experience (Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics or Data Science preferred).

Job Summary:
In this role, you will have an in-depth understanding of business processes, and define the use cases / user story for applications in Prudential Singapore. You will also develop acceptance criteria to provide assurance for quality of the applications releases. As part of this dynamic role, you will work closely with business units and other IT teams to deliver leading edge digital capabilities for Prudential Singapore.

Job Description:
Understand business process and define the business requirements in the form of use cases / user stories.
Design IT solutions together with relevant IT teams that will meet business requirements and timeline.
Deliver IT solutions in accordance to relevant IT policies and procedures.
Provide and share knowledge to other team members.

Who we are looking for:
Competencies & Personal Traits
Independent and works well across different functions.
Excellent problem analysis skill. Innovative and creative in developing solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong sense of drive and commitment to deliver on responsibilities.
Works well in a dynamic environment.
Ability and willingness to be hands-on.

Working Experience:
4-8 years in delivering IT applications.
Experience in Agile software development.

Education:
Bachelor degree

Language:
Fluent written and spoken English

Responsibilities :
Re-engineer the end-to-end process, analyze, and review operational solutions.
Conduct requirement gathering workshops, review, and document requirement artifacts.
Review functional specifications and process defined documents.
Coordinate and ensure UAT test plans and test cases are executed within the UAT schedule.
Provide post-production support, review production issues, and track them to closure.
Collaborate closely with regional and country teams to ensure timely project delivery.
Requirements :
Must have experience working in the banking domain.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in systems development and/or business process improvement initiatives, preferably with project lifecycle experience in the Financial Services Industry, specifically in Consumer Banking Operations and Corporate Banking Operations.
A hands-on team player who can see the big picture, possesses a can-do attitude, and can handle ambiguity in a fast-paced environment.
Strong interpersonal, coordination, and planning skills.
Proficient in understanding public web or customer-facing applications.
Skilled in utilizing tools like JIRA to document requirements effectively.
Capable of providing guidance to the Tech team regarding new requirements.
Effective in communicating with stakeholders from diverse backgrounds.
Capable of regularly updating management on the progress of these initiatives.

Roles & Responsibilities
At 7+ Academy, we’re proud to offer innovative products that meet the needs of our customers. To help us continue expanding our offerings, we’re in search of a Business Analyst to join our growing team in Singapore. This role will take charge of understanding and refining our business and operations.
Responsibilities:
using data modelling techniques to identify ways in which the company can operate more effectively.
communicate with senior management to find out what they hope to achieve.
formulate ways for businesses to improve, based on previous research and data analysis.
oversee the implementation of new technology and systems within the group.
understand how the company is doing, explore different solutions, their risks, benefits and impacts.
proposing solutions to senior management, and keeping them updated with progress.
creating documents to outline the proposed changes and the steps involved.
overseeing the implementation of new technology or a new approach.
contributing to training and support for people affected by new systems and processes.
Requirements:
Bilingual in English and Chinese.
Good education and first degree (Master's degree in Business is a plus).
Minimum 5 years experience in a business analyst role.
At least 3 years experience in a retail or related industry.
Commercial awareness and problem solving skills.
Good understanding of the China education system.
Highly motivated, good working attitude and strong sense of responsibility;
Experience in working in a multilingual and Chinese environment.
We offer an attractive package with excellent employee benefits, conducive working environment and career growth potential. Remuneration and benefits will commensurate with qualifications and experience.
Interested candidates are invited to apply online stating your current and expected salary and date of availability.

Company’s Profile
Julian Grey’s client is a solution provider for security and enterprise applications.

Supports mapping and reviewing existing business processes for cost savings, quality improvements, increased efficiencies, and reduced risks.

About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values – Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
Group Technology and Operations (GTO) provides software and system development, information technology support services and banking operations. We have centralized and standardized the technology components into Singapore, creating a global footprint which can be utilized for supporting our regional subsidiaries and the branches around the world. We operate and support 19 countries with this architecture to provide a secure and flexible banking infrastructure.
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralizing and standardizing technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
Requirements Analysis & Elicitation
Collaborate with BU Specialists to elicit and review business requirements.
Analyse and document the "to be" business and operations processes based on the agreed requirements and / or function points, perform impact assessment.
Be responsible to analyse and define detailed functional and non-functional requirements based on business requirements.
Monitor and manage risks /issues related to requirements and scope creep.
Write business functional release notes and contribute to deployment plan.
Team Collaboration
Transition functional and non-functional requirements to System Analysts, and ensure a clear and complete understanding of the requirements.
Work with Test Manager to translate business requirements into test scenarios.
Facilitate / provide "Train the Trainer" on application enhancements.
Maintain up to date knowledge base related to application features and processes (subject matter expertise).
Testing & Scope Management
Clarify test findings escalated by Test Manager and classify the findings accordingly (either as a defect or change request).
Perform impact assessment and estimation for Project Change Request.
Job Requirements

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science / Engineering / Business / Finance or equivalent
Minimum 10 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience
Strong business domain knowledge in banking:
Private Banking/Wealth experience.
Knowledge of the regulatory changes, especially in the sales & advisory process.
Strong knowledge of investment products.
Experience in designing end-to-end workflows.
Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into solutions that meet business objectives.
Extensive experience in technology and operational processes across functions / departments in the financial industry.
Resourceful team player.
Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals.
Strategic and forward thinking approach to challenges with strong communications, influencing, negotiating and persuasion skills.
Passionate, diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity.
Experience in scoping and evaluation – Defining overall considerations, including scalability, maintainability, cost, operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation.
Be a part of UOB Family

Company Description

“To be the most loved everyday food and groceries destination!” - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’).

foodpanda is the largest food and grocery delivery platform in Asia, outside of China. Operating in more than 400 cities across 11 markets, we continue to expand and grow in our core food delivery business, as well as in new verticals like grocery deliveries, with a strong tech infrastructure at our core. From our restaurants-partners, cloud kitchens and cloud grocery stores — foodpanda is just one tap away, getting everything you need into your hands quickly and conveniently!

If you love working with technology to create solutions and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done, you will find your tribe here at foodpanda. foodpanda comprises of people from more than 60 nationalities, and we believe in winning through diversity.
foodpanda is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide

Job Description
Work with key business stakeholders and regional data team (data analysts, data engineers, machine learning engineers) to deliver insights, reports, visualization and analysis to solve important business problems and optimize growth opportunities
Be passionate about working with big data to define, implement and monitor business KPIs, as well as to provide data driven insights to the business
Perform deep analytical dives into problems to troubleshoot and identify root causes and find solutions
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support cross functional projects

Qualifications
Fresh graduates/undergraduates are welcomed!
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong business mindset and ability to grasp business requirements from stakeholders
Champion of data and visualization with strong presentation and story-telling skills
Ability to write clean, structured, and high performance SQL code
Knowledge and experienced with BI tools (Tableau, Data Studio) is a plus
Knowledge with big data, Data Warehouse technologies, Python or R, is a plus
Knowledge of e-commerce is a plus
Commitment period of 6 months full-time and ability to start asap

Additional Information

What we offer:
A dynamic and challenging working environment, with an extra steep learning curve.
The chance to excel and influence in a company and team where decisions are taken based on data insights.
Being part of a fast growing and global company.
A vibrant and international team with diverse backgrounds
Growth opportunities based on your performance.
Flexible working environment.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners.

Role and Responsibilities:
Ensuring the business/operational objectives of the new business requirements are well defined
Performing systematic business analysis
Validating business requirements to align with business/operations needs as well as IT architecture and security standards.
Designing functional solutions & user workflows and documenting Functional Specifications.
Develop SIT/UAT/NRT scope and approach. To guide the Testing team in writing test scenarios/cases and review to get signoff from stakeholders.
Rationalize test cases when needed to match with available resources and target timeline.
Validate SIT test results produced by the testing team to sign off.
Assist users in planning/executing UAT, analyzing defects, and defining defects priority for fix delivery by the development team.
Ideal candidate:
Strong functional & business analysis skills with the ability to communicate and bridge between business/operations & IT.
Good functional experience in Supply chain/Trade/Electronic invoicing applications is preferred.
Good team player with great commitment and attitude.
Good communication and coordination skills among multiple teams that are cross-cultural and cross-country.
Ability to work independently.
Familiar with standard formats such as XML, SWIFT, EDIFACT, ISO20022 & data transformations.
Hands-on database SQL knowledge.
Experience in functional solutions design for large web applications and microservices, Well-versed with integrations and APIs, REST. Designing functional solutions for high volume, low latency, and high availability and performance requirements of web applications.
IT Design and development exposure is a definite plus.
Good understanding and knowledge of key security subjects (SSL/TLS, PKI, Certificates) and user authentication solutions.
5 - 8 years of experience in a Corporate Banking IT environment with the last 2-3 years as an IT Business Analyst, preferably in the domain of Trade Financing or supply chain Financing.
Worked in Agile and Waterfall SDLC mix project delivery environment with a large number of stakeholders and users involved.

About the opportunity

Work with key business stakeholders and regional data team (data analysts, data engineers, machine learning engineers) to deliver insights, reports, visualization and analysis to solve important business problems and optimize growth opportunities
Be passionate about working with big data to define, implement and monitor business KPIs, as well as to provide data driven insights to the business
Perform deep analytical dives into problems to troubleshoot and identify root causes and find solutions
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support cross functional projects

What you need to be successful

Fresh graduates/undergraduates are welcomed!
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong business mindset and ability to grasp business requirements from stakeholders
Champion of data and visualization with strong presentation and story-telling skills
Ability to write clean, structured, and high performance SQL code
Knowledge and experienced with BI tools (Tableau, Data Studio) is a plus
Knowledge with big data, Data Warehouse technologies, Python or R, is a plus
Knowledge of e-commerce is a plus
Commitment period of 6 months full-time and ability to start asap

Who we are

“To be the most loved everyday food and groceries destination!” - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’).

foodpanda is the largest food and grocery delivery platform in Asia, outside of China. Operating in more than 400 cities across 11 markets, we continue to expand and grow in our core food delivery business, as well as in new verticals like grocery deliveries, with a strong tech infrastructure at our core. From our restaurants-partners, cloud kitchens and cloud grocery stores — foodpanda is just one tap away, getting everything you need into your hands quickly and conveniently!

If you love working with technology to create solutions and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done, you will find your tribe here at foodpanda. foodpanda comprises of people from more than 60 nationalities, and we believe in winning through diversity.
foodpanda is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide

What's in it for you

What we offer:
A dynamic and challenging working environment, with an extra steep learning curve.
The chance to excel and influence in a company and team where decisions are taken based on data insights.
Being part of a fast growing and global company.
A vibrant and international team with diverse backgrounds
Growth opportunities based on your performance.
Flexible working environment.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners.

job title: Business Risk Specialist – Data Analytics & Sampling
description:
We’re looking for someone who can:
Capture requirements / data processing flows from discussions with various stakeholders across risk taxonomies and design automated solutions based on agreed methodology
Engage business and IT stakeholders depending on the situation and the challenge.
Dashboard and analytics will be related to business risk
Produce reports (reoccurring or ad-hoc) – expectations on data extraction to actual analysis and insights
Automation – current manual process or dashboard or automated reports to be sent out
Project management related task. Major initiatives from Switzerland.
Projects like deployment of engine to APAC
Some expectations on doing some trainings – whenever a new dashboard or reports that is new, this person need to give trainings (To business risk teams)
We are looking for candidate that has knowledge in Alteryx, Dataiku, Lavastorm, DAX, PowerBi, MicroStrategy, Tableau, ClickView, Phyton or Excel BA

Company Description

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.

Job Description

About the job
As a member of the Business Navigation team, you will play a key role in providing financial analysis and lead the staff optimisation process to deliver to the needs of the store. You will be involved in the staff planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes, translating the store’s strategies and goals into performance measurements through analysis and benchmarking. Working with multiple functions across the business, this is a highly visible role that represents a great opportunity to develop a thorough understanding of IKEA commercial operations.
Your assignment
Financial analysis
Having the full understanding of the store’s P&L, and support the Store Business Navigation Manager in steering actions to provide store in shape as new, reducing costs while considering all impacts on the store’s P&L.
Support the budgeting and forecasting process through close follow-up of the P&L and provide regular updates and recommendations to store management on the store’s financial position.
Identify, assess, and translate key industry trends into emerging risks and strategic business opportunities that shape the trajectory of our commercial opportunities.
Provide relevant and user-friendly business information on the store’s performance KPIs through dynamic reports. You influence with data, and articulate key insights to the store management team to drive sound business decision making.
Responsible for timely and accurate closing of the monthly account, and all necessary procedures for monthly closing and annual closing while ensuring compliance with IKEA accounting standard, legal, tax, and statutory compliance in Singapore.
Support the correct procurement of indirect material by requesting and comparing supplier quotations, performing periodic reviews on contract management and supervision to ensure purchases are compliant to procurement principles and IWAY standards.
Staff Planning
Support the staff planning process through analysis on productivity/ efficiency drivers to maximizing resource availability and skills across all departments.
Responsible for following up on the staff planning process from budgeting and forecasting and reporting, taking commercial influences taken into consideration.
Identifying and escalating when the schedule for actual hours exceeds the financial framework and possible improvements in the process for the store are identified.
Contribute to the deliverables of objectives in the store staffing approach with close follow up on staff planning and related retail KPIs with accurate reporting.
Responsible for safeguarding the stores complete staff planning process and performance and advising managers in ways to maximize resource availability.
Your profile
A professional with minimum 6 years of strong FP&A experience and business acumen and feels invigorated by a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
A globally recognised professional accounting qualification, e.g. CPA, ACCA, CIMA, etc., is preferred.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present financial information to non-financial stakeholders.
Ability to influence and galvanizing others to follow you toward a solution.
Process driven, results-oriented with excellent analytical capability and critical thinking skills.
Meticulous with strong attention to details and good follow-up skills.
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work collaboratively and effectively with multi-cultural business partners and stakeholders, within cross-functional teams in a matrix organization.
Experience in ERP or financial reporting systems like TM1, MVBC, Qilkview.
A retailer who contributes towards the business through actions and presence including weekends, public holidays, and on rotating shifts.

Location: Singapore

About Us: At Starhigh , we are a leading marine dredging company committed to excellence in coastal protection, land reclamation, and infrastructure development projects. With decades of experience and a reputation for innovation, we specialize in delivering sustainable solutions tailored to our clients' needs. As we continue to grow and diversify, we are seeking a dedicated Business Analyst to join our dynamic team in Singapore.

Job Description:
As a Business Analyst at Starhigh, you will play a pivotal role in driving strategic decision-making and operational excellence. You will leverage your analytical skills to analyze market trends, financial data, and project performance, providing valuable insights to support key stakeholders. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will identify opportunities for optimization, growth, and risk mitigation, ensuring the success of our projects and business objectives.

Responsibilities:
Conduct comprehensive analysis of market dynamics, competitor activity, and industry trends within the marine dredging sector, aligning with Starhigh’s strategic goals.
Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and finance teams to gather data and insights on project performance, costs, and profitability, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
Develop financial models, forecasts, and performance metrics to evaluate project feasibility and financial viability, contributing to informed decision-making.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, cost reduction, and revenue enhancement through data-driven analysis and insights, in line with Starhigh's commitment to sustainability.
Prepare regular reports, presentations, and dashboards to communicate findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders, supporting transparency and informed decision-making.
Support business development efforts by conducting market research, identifying potential clients, and assessing project opportunities, contributing to Starhigh's growth strategy.
Stay abreast of regulatory requirements, industry standards, and emerging trends impacting the marine dredging industry, informing company strategies and initiatives.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role within the marine dredging or maritime industry, with a track record of delivering impactful insights and recommendations.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and financial statements, aligned with Star High Dredging's commitment to excellence.
Familiarity with marine dredging operations, project management principles, and coastal engineering, supporting informed analysis and decision-making.
Proficiency in financial modeling, data analysis tools, and business intelligence software, enabling effective analysis and reporting.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders, fostering collaboration and alignment.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality, ensuring the integrity of data and analysis.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, embodying Star High Dredging's values of teamwork and professionalism.
Benefits:
Competitive salary package with performance incentives, reflecting Starhigh's commitment to rewarding excellence.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development, supported by a culture of continuous learning and growth.
Flexible working arrangements and remote work options, fostering work-life balance and flexibility.
Exposure to diverse and challenging marine dredging projects globally, contributing to personal and professional growth.
Dynamic and inclusive work culture with a focus on innovation and sustainability, creating a rewarding and fulfilling workplace environment.
If you are passionate about leveraging your analytical skills to drive business success in the marine dredging industry and share our commitment to excellence and sustainability, we invite you to join us at Starhigh. Together, let's shape the future of coastal development and environmental stewardship.

How to Apply:
Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this position to hr@starhighcom.sg
Kindly include "Business Analyst Application - Starhigh " in the subject line. We look forward to reviewing your application.

Singapore, Central, Singapore
Department
Operations
Job posted on
Apr 23, 2024
Employment type
Attachment
Develop Data analysis tool for Inventory Management and Sales Metrics
Create and maintain data models and dashboards for stakeholders to track key performance metrics.
Create and maintain data pipelines to automate data extraction and transformation processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide data-driven insights for decision-making.
Recommend best practices / techniques for data automation.
Maintenance of databases

Skills
Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Power BI, Excel and Python to support data analysis
Experience with data transformation, data visualization, data querying, database management and modelling.
Knowledge of web development concepts and technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.).

Working Location: 30 Hill Street Singapore 179360

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The TP ICAP Group is a world leading provider of market infrastructure.
Our purpose is to provide clients with access to global financial and commodities markets, improving price discovery, liquidity, and distribution of data, through responsible and innovative solutions.

Through our people and technology, we connect clients to superior liquidity and data solutions.

The Group is home to a stable of premium brands. Collectively, TP ICAP is the largest interdealer broker in the world by revenue, the number one Energy & Commodities broker in the world, the world’s leading provider of OTC data, and an award winning all-to-all trading platform.

The Group operates from more than 60 offices in 27 countries. We are 5,300 people strong. We work as one to achieve our vision of being the world’s most trusted, innovative, liquidity and data solutions specialist.

About Parameta Solutions
Parameta Solutions, the data and analytics division of inter-broker dealer TP ICAP, is a leading global provider of OTC Market Data. From pre to post trade, their solutions help clients manage complex markets more effectively.
In May 2022, the firm became an FCA authorized benchmark administrator. This license has allowed the company to take on administration of the nine TP ICAP interest rate swaps benchmarks that were previously administered by Moorgate Benchmarks. In April 2023, the firm was also approved as an ESMA authorised benchmark administrator, making it the first IDB to administer OTC benchmarks and indices across Europe AND the UK.

Central to Parameta’s purpose is partnering with clients to create true value. The team is focussed on helping clients navigate changing market conditions, not only by providing world-class proprietary data but also the analysis and insight that will fuel their strategies.

Role Overview:
The role requires to capture data from certain sources throughout the day covering specific cut times from several broker desks across all brands such as PVM/TP/ICAP as well as covers the first level support for client and distribution list requests either from clients or brokers. In addition, support our Sales team with knowledge around E&C information such as data, one-pagers or general information about the client and assist our Data Product team on tasks.

Role Responsibilities as to Price Reporting / Data Quality Analysis
Capturing data at various timestamps to prepare forward curves throughout the day for client purposes
Compiling forward curves by utilising different broker input channels
Publish data via several ways of distribution channels to the client with particular attention to deadlines in place
Liaising with respective broking desks to cross check/validate potentially erroneous and/or delayed data
Assist the Parameta Data Quality team by investigating and validating internal requests covering E&C data to iron out errors
Data analysis / fault diagnostics – also on historical data
Responsibility for ensuring that you are fully aware of and adhere to internal policies that relate to you, your role or any other activities for which you have any level of responsibility
Be compliant with operational risk requirements (e.g. cultural behaviours, security policies and regulatory requirements)
Complete any mandatory training by the required deadlines
Act with integrity and due skill, care and diligence in carrying out your duties.
Responsibilities as to Client and Sales/Data Product Support:
First line support of client enquiries especially during morning hours

Company Description

Life at Grab

At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.

Job Description

About the role
It takes a village to give a safe and delightful service to our customers. As things get more complex, “the village” needs highly skilled data analysts who can lift their head above the noise and guide us through data insights on what is truly best for our customers. This is you. You will support data projects working with different teams across Grab with the purpose of giving our customers the best service in the world.
Responsibilities
Functional
Independently assemble large and complex data sets that meet the business or analytical needs
Build and deploy data models that help optimize support experience
Work closely with the Business or Operations Teams to understand their problem statements and conceptualize analytics frameworks that convert business problems into technical hypotheses
Design and recommend A/B testing to evaluate the model performance and provide interpretation of the experiment results, and provide data-driven recommendation
Develop and maintain data insights and performance dashboards
Customer
This is everything. You have to be the radical advocate for our users, laser focused on the quality of their experience with us above anything else
People
Lead the charge: Influence and serve in order to deliver through others
Role model at all times Grab 4Hs to ensure we are always, always, working in a way that our behaviours would make us proud

Qualifications
At least 3 years of data analytics experience
High level of flexibility in working in a high-pressure working environment
Project management skills - Proven track record in executing and delivering projects independently
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with stakeholders across several organization levels and several cultures
Bachelor degree with strong academic track record
Advanced knowledge of analytical tools such as Power Apps, PowerBI
Strong knowledge in SQL to extract large disconnected datasets on Azure/AWS data platform
Preferred knowledge of data programming (Python, R)
Familiar with User experience function and tools is good to have
Familiar with startup environment and understanding of dynamics between design, engineering, product and customer service are a plus

Additional Information

Our Commitment

We recognize that with these individual attributes come different workplace challenges, and we will work with Grabbers to address them in our journey towards creating inclusion at Grab for all Grabbers.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a Business Analyst, you'll drive structure and discipline around each initiative using standard project deliverables and framework, including establishing scope, and perform detailed business impact analysis in support of management decisions. Additionally, you'll define roles and responsibilities, establish and document requirements, resolve resource/scheduling conflicts, escalate and ensure issues/decisions are resolved, manage changes to project scope, document and complete testing requirements, create and manage implementation plans, and lead/participate in meetings at the operational and project level. You'll provide continuous feedback on project status and issues and serve as the overall escalation point to ensure the project tracks to original expectations.
Responsibilities:
Project analysis, including documenting business requirements, detailing issues and risks, and drafting business processes and data flows
Data analysis, including data collection, synthesis, and translation of results into concrete actionable solutions
Identify gaps between applicable requirements and current procedures/controls and drive resolution of mitigating controls
Work with business partners to design and implement enhancements to existing processes and/or business applications, introduce new processes and/or toolsets, and engage in process re-engineering
Develop and implement solutions that strengthen business operating models, enhance the client experience, and improve efficiency and controls
Define user acceptance test plans and test cases, coordinate and execute user acceptance testing and interpret, assess, and communicate results to enable signoff on deliverables
Provide implementation support, inclusive of testing and process change management, and ensure those implementations meet requirements established by Oversight and Control partners
Apply a critical eye in evaluating existing processes and frameworks; challenge the status quo and recommend solutions / enhancements to operating models and controls
Qualifications:
1-3 years business analysis experience
Bachelor’s degree required
Excellent communication and presentations skills across various stakeholders and senior management
Intermediate/Advanced experience using Microsoft Office, including Excel, Visio and PowerPoint
Excellent analytical and logical thinking to understand and analyze complex business processes
Strong organizational and prioritization skills, detail-oriented and strong interpersonal skills
Ability to analyze and resolve project-related issues and follow through with set objectives
Ability to deal with different stakeholder groups to elicit business requirements, procedures, and processes
Ability to work in a high paced environment, be flexible, follow tight deadlines, organize and prioritize work
Be a team player who shows commitment and dedication, and can maintain a positive attitude and high-level of performance on high-profile/time-sensitive initiatives

ABOUT THE TEAM
Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.


Operations teams develop and manage innovative, secure service solutions to meet clients’ needs globally. Developing and using the latest technology, teams work to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it easy and convenient to do business with the firm. Teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven customer and client experiences that put users first, providing an unparalleled experience.

The TP ICAP Group is a world leading provider of market infrastructure.

Our purpose is to provide clients with access to global financial and commodities markets, improving price discovery, liquidity, and distribution of data, through responsible and innovative solutions.

Through our people and technology, we connect clients to superior liquidity and data solutions.

The Group is home to a stable of premium brands. Collectively, TP ICAP is the largest interdealer broker in the world by revenue, the number one Energy & Commodities broker in the world, the world’s leading provider of OTC data, and an award winning all-to-all trading platform.

The Group operates from more than 60 offices in 27 countries. We are 5,300 people strong. We work as one to achieve our vision of being the world’s most trusted, innovative, liquidity and data solutions specialist.
Role Overview:
The Management Information Desk (MID) provides a central hub for key business analysis in the APAC region. Key tasks include preparation of feasibilities for new hires and exiting employees, restructuring and scenario analysis, new business investment proposals, management of hiring pipeline and the standardization of process and procedures to ensure informed decision making and best possible regional performance.
The role of the Commercial Analyst – MID APAC is to prepare timely and accurate management reports to assist the Head of MID, APAC COO and APAC GB Head with Commercial decision making. The individual needs to have strong attention to detail, be able to prioritise and manage workload, and be passionate about pursuing a career in commercial analysis and reporting. Prior experience working with a ‘Inter-Dealer-Broker’, Trading Bank, or ‘Other trading business’ is not necessary, but an interest in financial markets is recommended. The individual will need to adopt a structured and investigative approach to their workload and be able to present all information in a clear, comprehensive manner, both verbal and written.
The individual will report to the Head of MID – APAC but will field requests from the APAC GB Head, APAC COO and regional MD’s directly from time-to-time. Tasks need to be completed in a timely and accurate manner and the individual will be assessed on the accuracy, timeliness, and quality of responses.
The role will require ability to learn on the job and build a strong analytical skillset over time.
Role Responsibilities:
Provide timely and accurate contract summary and P&L models for new hires, renewals and employee exits (the CRF process). Present the financial impact to desk, business, and region to assist MD, COO and CEO decision making.
Maintain the CRF tracking file and be able to advise on the status of CRF’s at any point in the approval process. Produce statistics on CRFs in aggregated fashion across multiple metrics at the request of APAC MID Head, APAC GB Head.
Work with HR to ensure contracts are prepared in accordance with CRF guidelines and chase up signed contracts in timely fashion. Ensure that MID have a complete database of contracts for easy access.
Prepare post-hire performance analysis and communicate to management at set intervals after their start date so that appropriate action can be taken.
Administer and manage the APAC regional hiring pipeline. Have a strong working knowledge of contractual terms and assist with modelling and analysis needed for negotiations.
Refresh and send monthly management packs to MDs in APAC. Work with finance to ensure the GL is closed prior to refresh and ensure regional consistency of key performance indicator metrics.
Prepare Executive committee packs for APAC and Group meetings that take place monthly. Ensure insightful commentary and analysis.
Maintain datasets and databases used by MID for reporting and analysis.
Prepare accurate and timely adhoc analysis as requested by manager, APAC GB Head, COO and MDs.
Build strong working relationships with MD’s, Desk Managers, and support teams to achieve respect and trust in the role.
Be willing to attend calls/meetings after-hours if required.
Experience/Competences:
Essential
Genuine interest in pursuing a career in financial analytics and management reporting.
Task orientated and strong work ethic to meet deadlines.
A team player with a collaborative, proactive and responsive mind-set.
Ability to work with highly confidential information and be trusted. Integrity in dealings.
Displays excellent written and oral communication skills and is articulate with attention to detail.
Strong excel skills or ability to learn quickly on the job. Must be a self-starter who can figure out how to do things without much instruction or formal training.
Basic understanding of P&L, BS and Cashflow and understands how a chart of accounts feeds into financial statements.
Must be able to interrogate financial systems and seek answers when/if data not as it should be or forthcoming.
Ability to manage monthly management reporting packs production in autonomous fashion
Good written communication skills in Microsoft Office - Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree qualification in accounting, finance or business required.
Desired
Ability to manage workload and prioritise tasks in an organised and efficient manner.
Strong personal organisational skills with the ability to deliver under pressure with tight deadlines.
Experience working in an accounting team in junior accounting capacity is preferred.
Ability to communicate with all levels of management including C-level executives.
Experience with an Inter-Dealer-Broker or Trading bank would be preferable.

REV - Revenue Management
Singapore
Cathay Pacific
Application Deadline
07 May 2024

Company Description

Let your passion fly! We’re proud to be one of the world’s leading airlines. Our reputation is built on a long track record of success, an ongoing commitment to our home Hong Kong, and on the delivery of customer service that’s straight from the heart. All of this is possible due to our talented people who share our passion for aviation and our commitment to being the best. Our global family can open up a world of opportunities for you. This means that your first role at Cathay Pacific won’t be your last. It could take you anywhere. Join us and discover just how far you can go!
Role Introduction

The Senior Data Insights Analyst is responsible to support the Business Insights &Analytics Manger in the analysis, implementation and performance management of the market or region for optimisation of Corporate, Agency and Digital sales programmes.
In this role, you will support the Business Insights & Analytics team’s end-to-end regional commercial strategy planning process, starting from goal setting, initiatives formulation to implementation and tracking, with the aim to drive revenue across different customer segments and distribution channels. You will use data analytical tools (both internal and external) to perform analysis and provide commercial teams (i.e. Local/Regional Marketing, Digital, Sales teams) with actionable insights that helps to identify revenue opportunities. You will also be responsible for measuring the success of all sales or go-to-market activities, as well as sharing all learnings with respective stakeholders for future improvements.

Key Responsibilities

Business Planning
Work closely with Head Office (Revenue Management, Sales & Distribution, Digital) and Regional Teams on end-to-end business planning process, from developing strategic commercial strategy, campaigns/initiatives planning to execution and performance tracking
Consolidate local market intelligence or any sales opportunities (e.g. MICE, special group movements) and share/discuss with Head Office with proposed plan to win deals with high success rates and incremental revenue
Develop targeted and customer-centric incentives action plans that are competitive in the local markets within assigned budget
Support local sales teams in tracking incentives performance, business development or up-/cross-selling activities so that CX remains as the preferred choice for the trade partners and for our customers
Observe market activities and brainstorm with local stakeholders to design customized products for targeted customer segments, and collaborate with Head Office for new product launch
Assist Regional Head of Business Insights & Analytics to formulate commercial budget plan
Be actively involved in formulating and ensuring the achievement of the offline market distribution strategy for the region (if applicable)
Devise strategy to improve value of incentives and NDC remunerations in the region
Analytics Champion
Act as the analytics champion for the region – i.e. well-versed with all in-house and external data analytical tools (i.e. DDS, QlikSense, PRISM)
Analyze data, develop reports, draw inferences and provide actionable insights to Regional Sales Teams, including new trends/customer purchase behaviors, new sales opportunities and areas of improvements
Own the performance tracking of all campaigns/ initiatives with clear and defined metrics; identify learning points and continue to improve so as to achieve the target
Drive adoption of all analytical tools and cultivate data-driven culture within the Regional and Outport teams
Conduct ad-hoc commercial studies and support Head Office-driven analytics projects when required
Pricing and Fare Filing
Provide local-specific insights in the formulation of pricing strategies with HO RMO
Monitor the effectiveness of the pricing strategies and initiate change discussions when needed
Responsible for year-round proactive campaign planning process – i.e. developing campaign proposals, benchmarking, market insights and campaign tracking
Review and analyze local market Corporate discount parameters, Global Specialty products (i.e. students/MICE/Seamen/Cruise)
Manage communications with local sales teams on fare changes, fare conditions revision, new products/campaigns launches and/or any government fares filing (if required)
Provide Corporates fare filing support (i.e. new or updated changes) for local Corporate sales teams
Assist with checking new live fares on GDS to ensure 100% accuracy and troubleshooting of any fare auto-pricing errors
Manage ad-hoc fare proposal and requests
E&A Responsibility
Emergency and Accident and Crisis Response responsibilities as required
Requirements

Qualifications and Requirements
University Degree (Preferably in related disciplines) with minimum 3+ years’ experience in data analysis in a regional team set up
Strong numeric and statistical analytical skills are essential
Able to present analysis clearly with findings and actionable insights

job title: Head of Analytics and Business Intelligence
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
As the world's leading owner and operator of LPG carriers with five decades of operating experience, BW LPG promotes competitive, sustainable solutions to secure value for society and our stakeholders.
Our global footprint spans seven countries with 17 nationalities represented across our workforce. Our fleet of 39 Very Large Gas Carriers (VLGC) offer a total carrying capacity of over 3 million CBM. From spot voyages and time charters to Contracts of Affreightments (CoAs), our emphasis on flexible, reliable service has earned the trust of leading oil companies as well as trading and utility companies. More information about BW LPG can be found at www.bwlpg.com.
BW LPG is associated with BW Group, a leading global maritime company involved in shipping, floating infrastructure, deepwater oil & gas production, and new sustainable technologies. Founded in 1955 by Sir YK Pao, BW controls a fleet of over 490 vessels transporting oil, gas and dry commodities, with its 200 LNG and LPG ships constituting the largest gas fleet in the world. In the renewables space, the group has investments in solar, wind, batteries, biofuels and water treatment. BW LPG, as a member of the BW Group, is one of Forbes World's Best Employers 2023.
Join BW LPG as our Head of Analytics and Business Intelligence
Are you passionate about shaping the future of data architecture, business intelligence and realize the inherent value? BW LPG, a global leader in the LPG shipping industry, is seeking a dynamic and visionary Head of Analytics and Business Intelligence to lead our journey towards excellence in data usage.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Position Overview:
In this role, you'll lead a small, forward-thinking team dedicated to revolutionizing how we harness and leverage data to drive informed decision-making and profits.
You will play a pivotal role in architecting and accelerating the development of our data warehouse on the Azure platform. Your responsibilities will encompass leading a talented team, actively engaging in development, collaborating with business stakeholders, and governing data-related projects executed by external consultants.
Key Responsibilities:
Actively participate in hands-on development of deliveries
Lead and motivate a small team of dedicated professionals, fostering a culture of business acumen, innovation, collaboration, fun and excellence
Architect and oversee the development and tool selection for our data warehouse and reporting solutions being built on Azure and associated tools, as well as DBT, Python, Databricks and Power BI
Drive strategic planning of data initiatives in collaboration with the company management team
Engage with business users to understand requirements, challenge ways of working, design robust solutions, and ensure alignment between IT initiatives and business objectives
Manage and personally implement data sourcing, availability, quality management, and governance initiatives, ensuring compliance with industry standards
Identify areas of improvement for data management and value realization
Work with and manage vendor deliveries as appropriate to accelerate progress and ensure quality
Drive initiatives to leverage AI tools for enhanced data insights and improved end-user efficiency
Work with our vendors of IOT based analysis tools to realize the potential commercial benefits
Initiate and drive collaboration across departments and business units
QUALIFICATIONS
Proven leadership capabilities, with the ability to lead a team, formulate strategies and collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, cultural awareness, and understanding
Extensive experience in data warehouse architecture, development, and implementation, preferably on Azure
Proficiency in developing and architecting solutions based on relevant technology
Strong project management skills, including overseeing external consultants and ensuring project delivery within scope, time, and budget
Familiarity with AI tools and their application in enhancing data insights and user efficiency
Commercial mindset and ability to strategically align our project portfolio with bottom-line impact
Prior experience from the Maritime or comparable industry is a plus
Why Join Us:
Opportunity to lead transformative initiatives in a dynamic and ambitious organization
International and highly competent working environment
Collaborative and supportive work culture that encourages innovation and professional growth
Competitive compensation package and benefits
If you are driven by the prospect of spearheading data-driven transformation and shaping the future of BW LPG's data strategy, we invite you to join us on this exciting journey.
Apply now to be part of our team and make a significant impact on the future of the maritime industry!
OTHER INFORMATION
The position will be based in Singapore.
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - BW LPG Holding Pte Ltd

Presently in a hands-on capacity, in writing BRDs and involved in testing.

Job Type: Permanent
Pay: $9,000.00 - $11,000.00 per month
Work Location: In person

About the opportunity

Analytics (50%):
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and data requirements.
Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights, trends, and patterns that can inform business decisions.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate analytical findings effectively.
Data Engineering (50%):
Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and transforming large volumes of data.
Work with big data technologies and platforms to ensure efficient and reliable data processing.
Implement data quality checks and ensure the integrity and accuracy of datasets.
Collaborate with IT and engineering teams to optimize data infrastructure and support data-driven initiatives.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, ensuring the smooth flow of information across the organization.

What you need to be successful

Domain Experience: Prior experience in B2C environments, particularly in Ecommerce and Food Delivery, is highly desirable, showcasing an understanding of customer behavior and market dynamics.
Project Experience: Proven track record in leading past projects, particularly in Ecommerce and Food Delivery domains, showcasing the ability to apply analytical skills to real-world scenarios. Curiosity and structured thinking are key qualities we seek, enabling the candidate to approach problems methodically and uncover insights effectively.
Technical Expertise: Keen understanding of technical concepts such as Cost per uplift, Cost per order, and ROI.
Software Skills: Proficiency in either PowerBI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio is essential for effective data visualization and analysis.
Database Knowledge: Strong familiarity with AWS databases is required to handle large volumes of data effectively.
External Tools: Experience with Braze is essential, along with familiarity with tools like Data.ai and App Annie for comprehensive data analysis.
Analytical Skills: Demonstrated ability to break down problem statements, test hypotheses, and conduct analytical techniques such as segmentation, root cause/cluster/cohort analysis.

Who we are

“To be the most loved everyday food and groceries destination!” - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’).

foodpanda is the largest food and grocery delivery platform in Asia, outside of China. Operating in more than 400 cities across 11 markets, we continue to expand and grow in our core food delivery business, as well as in new verticals like grocery deliveries, with a strong tech infrastructure at our core. From our restaurants-partners, cloud kitchens and cloud grocery stores — foodpanda is just one tap away, getting everything you need into your hands quickly and conveniently!

If you love working with technology to create solutions and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done, you will find your tribe here at foodpanda. foodpanda comprises of people from more than 60 nationalities, and we believe in winning through diversity.
foodpanda is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide

What's in it for you

What we offer
A dynamic and challenging work environment.
A company committed to developing you personally and professionally.
A great working atmosphere with regular company and team events.
A vibrant and international team committed to diversity and inclusion.
Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company.
Other benefits include free food, health and dental insurance, and learning and development opportunities!

Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners.

job title: Sr. Partner Business Development Specialist, Analytics
description:
7+ years of developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience
7+ years of professional or military experience
Bachelor's degree
Experience developing strategies that influence leadership decisions at the organizational level
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a world class partner and alliance leader to join the Data and Analytics partner team to lead business development efforts with System Integrator (SI), Channel, and Consulting Partners. As a Sr. Partner Development Specialist (PDS) for Analytics in ASEAN, you will have an exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to accelerate adoption of AWS within Data, Analytics, and Advanced Analytics practices of strategic partners while working with a world-class team of other Partner Development Specialists focused on the same mission. You will help them develop capabilities, AWS powered data, analytics and BI offerings, develop and execute go-to-market and enablement plans, leading to healthy business pipeline, joint customer wins and market success.

Establishing secure and optimized data, analytics, and BI architectures on AWS Cloud is strategically important for our customers. In this role, you will work with partners to help them build growth oriented and strategically focused practices to deliver on these customer and market expectations. In this endeavor, you will collaborate with a number of AWS internal teams including partner managers, solution architects, sales, product, BD, marketing, and solution teams to position and deliver these capabilities internally and to partners. You will be responsible for building Analytics practice plans for each partner and owning the execution of all elements of the plan including but not limited to enablement, GTMs, sales plays, executive alignment, supporting strategic deals, and relationship governance. AWS Data and Analytics organization will look to you as the expert on your managed partners and to drive AWS market success through them. You will also act as a mentor to the regional analytics PDS team, bringing your substantial experience in coaching and guiding the team into delivering customer and partner success.

You should have a multi-faceted background to succeed in this position including a deep understanding of SI/Consulting business, selling software and consulting projects into enterprise customers, and building alliances between technology and consulting organizations. Ideally this expertise would have been acquired in similar positions at other enterprise software companies or working within SI organizations while engaging closely with technology firms. Additionally, you should have a deep understanding of the data, analytics, and BI technology landscape and ideally, an understanding of machine learning and generative AI capabilities. You should have a solid understanding the data and analytics market dynamics, and a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, process, and technical challenges, as well as build and convey compelling business cases and value propositions.

Key Responsibilities:
Working with cross functional partner and AWS teams, build and drive analytics business plans which serve as blueprints for a partner’s growth
Understand SI strategy and help build and drive go to market initiatives to support differentiation, customer wins, and market success
Drive partner pipeline and customer wins through focused sales plays, GTMs, and campaigns
Work with technical teams on both sides to identify, develop, and launch value add solutions/offerings which showcase SI capabilities and AWS technologies
Create and drive enablement plans for SI teams in support of business needs
Support SI market expansion in new geographies, vertical segments, and use cases by aligning with respective AWS teams and growth strategies
Prepare and deliver business reviews to AWS and partner senior leaders including business metrics, goal achievements, and overall health of business
25% travel expected for partner meetings, supporting GTMs and meeting customers
10010

About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Singapore, SGP

Experience as a founder or executive focused on related segments, or as a practice leader or business unit owner
Experience selling to Fortune 1000 or Global 2000 organizations
